trans-unit.source: Configuration management tools allow you write configuration files, using a declarative language to manage a server. These tools focus on building working servers by installing and configuring system settings, system libraries, and application libraries before an application is installed on the server. Chef Habitat focuses on the application first instead of the server. Chef Habitat builds and packages your application’s entire binary toolchain, including the system libraries, application libraries, and runtime dependencies necessary for your application to function. As a result, Chef Habitat can replace many use-cases that configuration management tools perform related to installing system binaries, application dependent libraries, or templating configuration files.
trans-unit.target: 使用配置管理工具，您可以使用声明性语言来管理服务器来编写配置文件。这些工具专注于通过在服务器上安装应用程序之前安装和配置系统设置，系统库和应用程序库来构建工作服务器。 Chef Habitat首先关注应用程序，而不是服务器。 Chef Habitat构建并打包了应用程序的整个二进制工具链，包括应用程序正常运行所需的系统库，应用程序库和运行时依赖项。结果，Chef Habitat可以替换配置管理工具执行的许多用例，这些用例与安装系统二进制文件，依赖于应用程序的库或模板化配置文件有关。

trans-unit.source: Configuration management tools perform tasks at run time by converging resources. The value from configuration management tools comes from this converging process – checking the existing state of a server, and fixing it if it does not match the intended state. Because converging modifies resources at runtime, it can result in surprising and complex runtime errors. In addition, since environments are often mutable and unique, maintaining server automation occurs out-of-band with application development, creating conflict between application developers and software reliability engineers. Chef Habitat avoids these classes of errors entirely by shifting these processes to build time, and by creating an atomic package of an application’s binaries, application lifecycle hooks, and configuration files. Chef Habitat’s approach to packaging automation with the application package allows application developers and software reliability engineers to work closer together.
trans-unit.target: 配置管理工具在运行时通过聚合资源来执行任务。配置管理工具的价值来自于这一融合过程–检查服务器的现有状态，并在服务器与预期状态不匹配时对其进行修复。由于聚合会在运行时修改资源，因此可能会导致令人惊讶且复杂的运行时错误。此外，由于环境通常是易变且独特的，因此维护服务器自动化是在应用程序开发之外进行的，从而在应用程序开发人员和软件可靠性工程师之间造成冲突。 Chef Habitat通过将这些过程转移到构建时间上，并通过创建应用程序二进制文件，应用程序生命周期挂钩和配置文件的原子包来完全避免此类错误。Chef Habitat借助应用程序包进行包装自动化的方法使应用程序开发人员和软件可靠性工程师可以更加紧密地合作。

trans-unit.source: Configuration updates can be encrypted for the service group they are intended. To do so, pass the --user option with the name of your user key, and the --org option with the organization of the service group. If you have the public key for the service group, the data will be encrypted for that key, signed with your user key, and sent to the ring.
trans-unit.target: 可以针对预期的服务组对配置更新进行加密。为此，请将 --user 选项与用户密钥的名称一起传递，并将 --org 选项与服务组的组织一起传递。如果您具有服务组的公共密钥，则将对该密钥进行数据加密，并用您的用户密钥签名，然后发送到环网。

trans-unit.source: Configuration updates for service groups must be versioned. The version number must be an integer that starts at one and must be incremented with every subsequent update to the same service group. If the version number is less than or equal to the current version number, the change(s) will not be applied.
trans-unit.target: 服务组的配置更新必须进行版本控制。版本号必须是一个从1开始的整数，并且每次对同一服务组的每次更新都必须增加。如果版本号小于或等于当前版本号，则更改将不适用。

trans-unit.source: Configure group permissions for files. A string or ID that identifies the group owner by group name, including fully qualified group names such as domain\group or group@domain. If this value is not specified, existing groups remain unchanged and new group assignments use the default POSIX group (if available).

trans-unit.source: Considerations
trans-unit.target: Considerations

trans-unit.source: Consistent Hash -based load balancing can be used to provide soft session affinity based on HTTP headers, cookies or other properties. This load balancing policy is applicable only for HTTP connections. The affinity to a particular destination host will be lost when one or more hosts are added/removed from the destination service. This field specifies parameters that control consistent hashing. This field only applies if the load_balancing_scheme is set to INTERNAL_SELF_MANAGED. This field is only applicable when locality_lb_policy is set to MAGLEV or RING_HASH.
trans-unit.target: 基于哈希值的负载均衡可用于提供基于HTTP头、cookies或其他属性的软会话亲和力。该负载均衡策略仅适用于HTTP连接。当从目标服务中添加/删除一个或多个主机时,将失去对特定目标主机的亲和力。此字段指定控制一致散列的参数。该字段仅适用于将 load_balancing_scheme 设置为 INTERNAL_SELF_MANAGED 的情况。此字段仅在 locality_lb_policy 设置为 MAGLEV 或 RING_HASH 时适用。

trans-unit.source: Consistent Hash-based load balancing can be used to provide soft session affinity based on HTTP headers, cookies or other properties. This load balancing policy is applicable only for HTTP connections. The affinity to a particular destination host will be lost when one or more hosts are added/removed from the destination service. This field specifies parameters that control consistent hashing. This field only applies when all of the following are true: load_balancing_scheme is set to INTERNAL_MANAGED, protocol is set to HTTP, HTTPS, or HTTP2, and locality_lb_policy is set to MAGLEV or RING_HASH
trans-unit.target: 基于Hash的一致负载平衡可用于基于HTTP标头，Cookie或其他属性提供软会话亲和力。此负载平衡策略仅适用于HTTP连接。当从目标服务添加/删除一个或多个主机时，与特定目标主机的亲和性将丢失。该字段指定控制一致哈希的参数。仅当满足以下所有条件时，此字段才适用： load_balancing_scheme 设置为INTERNAL_MANAGED， protocol 设置为HTTP，HTTPS或HTTP2， locality_lb_policy 设置为MAGLEV或RING_HASH

trans-unit.source: Contain Chef Infra Client runs in a secondary process with dedicated RAM. When a Chef Infra Client run is complete, the RAM is returned to the master process. This option helps ensure that a Chef Infra Client uses a steady amount of RAM over time because the master process does not run recipes. This option also helps prevent memory leaks such as those that can be introduced by the code contained within a poorly designed cookbook. Use --no-fork to disable running Chef Infra Client in fork node. Default value: --fork.
trans-unit.target: 包含Chef Infra Client在带有专用RAM的辅助进程中运行。 Chef Infra Client运行完成后，RAM返回到主进程。此选项有助于确保Chef Infra Client随着时间的推移使用稳定数量的RAM，因为主进程不会运行配方。此选项还有助于防止内存泄漏，例如设计不佳的食谱中包含的代码可能导致的内存泄漏。使用 --no-fork 禁用在fork节点中运行Chef Infra Client。默认值：-- --fork 。

trans-unit.source: Contain Chef Infra Client runs in a secondary process with dedicated RAM. When a Chef Infra Client run is complete, the RAM is returned to the master process. This setting helps ensure that a Chef Infra Client uses a steady amount of RAM over time because the master process does not run recipes. This setting also helps prevent memory leaks such as those that can be introduced by the code contained within a poorly designed cookbook. Default value: true. Set to false to disable running Chef Infra Client in fork node.
trans-unit.target: 包含Chef Infra Client在带有专用RAM的辅助进程中运行。 Chef Infra Client运行完成后，RAM返回到主进程。此设置有助于确保Chef Infra Client随着时间的推移使用稳定数量的RAM，因为主进程不会运行配方。此设置还有助于防止内存泄漏，例如设计不佳的食谱中包含的代码可能导致的内存泄漏。默认值： true 。设置为 false 可禁用在fork节点中运行Chef Infra Client。

trans-unit.source: Contain the chef-client run in a secondary process with dedicated RAM. When the chef-client run is complete, the RAM is returned to the master process. This option helps ensure that a chef-client uses a steady amount of RAM over time because the master process does not run recipes. This option also helps prevent memory leaks such as those that can be introduced by the code contained within a poorly designed cookbook. Use --no-fork to disable running the chef-client in fork node. Default value: --fork.
trans-unit.target: 通过专用RAM包含在辅助进程中运行的Chef-Client。Chef-client运行完成后，RAM返回到主进程。此选项有助于确保厨师客户端随时间推移使用稳定数量的RAM，因为主进程不会运行配方。此选项还有助于防止内存泄漏，例如设计不佳的食谱中包含的代码可能导致的内存泄漏。使用 --no-fork 禁用在fork节点中运行Chef-client。默认值：-- --fork 。

trans-unit.source: Contain the chef-client run in a secondary process with dedicated RAM. When the chef-client run is complete, the RAM is returned to the master process. This option helps ensure that a chef-client uses a steady amount of RAM over time because the master process does not run recipes. This option also helps prevent memory leaks such as those that can be introduced by the code contained within a poorly designed cookbook. Use --no-fork to disable running the chef-client in fork node. Default value: --fork. This option may not be used in the same command with the --daemonize and --interval options.
trans-unit.target: 通过专用RAM包含在辅助进程中运行的Chef-Client。 Chef-client运行完成后，RAM返回到主进程。此选项有助于确保厨师客户端随时间推移使用稳定数量的RAM，因为主进程不会运行配方。此选项还有助于防止内存泄漏，例如设计不佳的食谱中包含的代码可能导致的内存泄漏。使用 --no-fork 禁用在fork节点中运行Chef-client。默认值：-- --fork 。此选项可能无法与 --daemonize 和 --interval 选项在同一命令中使用。

trans-unit.source: Containers
trans-unit.target: Containers

trans-unit.source: Containers are an approach to virtualization that allows a single operating system to host many working configurations, where each working configuration—a container—is assigned a single responsibility that is isolated from all other responsibilities. Containers are popular as a way to manage distributed and scalable applications and services.
trans-unit.target: 容器是一种虚拟化方法，它允许单个操作系统托管许多工作配置，其中为每个工作配置（一个容器）分配了与所有其他职责隔离的单个职责。容器作为管理分布式和可伸缩应用程序和服务的一种方式而流行。

trans-unit.source: Containers are an approach to virtualization that allows a single operating system to host many working configurations, where each working configuration---a container---is assigned a single responsibility that is isolated from all other responsibilities. Containers are popular as a way to manage distributed and scalable applications and services.
trans-unit.target: 容器是一种虚拟化的方法,它允许一个操作系统托管许多工作配置,其中每个工作配置---容器---被分配了一个单一的责任,它与所有其他责任是隔离的。容器作为一种管理分布式和可扩展的应用程序和服务的方式,很受欢迎。

trans-unit.source: Containers enable you to build an immutable snapshot of your runtime environment, including your operating system, system libraries, application libraries, and application. The container is built with a CLI tool, and then pushed to a container-specific artifact repository, known as a container registry. Chef Habitat is not a container format and exports your application to the container format of your choice.
trans-unit.target: 容器使您能够构建运行时环境的不可改变的快照,包括您的操作系统、系统库、应用程序库和应用程序。容器是用CLI工具构建的,然后推送到容器特定的工件仓库,即所谓的容器注册表。Chef Habitat不是容器格式,而是将你的应用程序导出到你选择的容器格式。

trans-unit.source: Contains Chef Infra Client runs in a secondary process with dedicated RAM. When a Chef Infra Client run is complete, the RAM is returned to the master process. This option helps ensure that a Chef Infra Client uses a steady amount of RAM over time because the master process does not run recipes. This option also helps prevent memory leaks such as those that can be introduced by the code contained within a poorly designed cookbook. Use --no-fork to disable running Chef Infra Client in fork node. Default value: --fork. This option may not be used in the same command with the --daemonize and --interval options.
trans-unit.target: 包含Chef Infra Client在带有专用RAM的辅助进程中运行。Chef Infra Client运行完成后，RAM返回到主进程。此选项有助于确保Chef Infra Client随着时间的推移使用稳定数量的RAM，因为主进程不会运行配方。此选项还有助于防止内存泄漏，例如设计不佳的食谱中包含的代码可能导致的内存泄漏。使用 --no-fork 禁用在fork节点中运行Chef Infra Client。默认值：-- --fork 。此选项不能与 --daemonize 和 --interval 选项一起在同一命令中使用。

trans-unit.source: Continuous deployment is a well-known software development practice of building and testing code changes in preparation for a release to a production environment.
trans-unit.target: 持续部署是一种众所周知的软件开发实践,即构建和测试代码变更,为发布到生产环境做准备。

trans-unit.source: Continuous integration allows you to build, test, and deploy your code by using CLI tools and plugins. Chef Habitat includes the Chef Habitat Studio which allows you to do interactive builds on your developer workstation, or non-interactive builds with your continuous integration server. Your continuous integration server can also call the Chef Habitat CLI to promote your Chef Habitat packages to different channels, enabling your applications to update themselves. Chef Habitat is not a continuous integration server and can make builds and promotion processes done by your continuous integration server easier.
trans-unit.target: 持续集成使您可以使用CLI工具和插件来构建，测试和部署代码。 Chef Habitat包含Chef Habitat Studio，可让您在开发人员工作站上进行交互式构建，或与持续集成服务器进行非交互式构建。您的持续集成服务器还可以调用Chef Habitat CLI，以将Chef Habitat软件包升级到不同的渠道，从而使您的应用程序能够自我更新。 Chef Habitat不是连续集成服务器，它可以使您的连续集成服务器完成的构建和升级过程变得更加容易。

trans-unit.source: Controls the phase during which a gem is installed on a node. Set to true to install a gem while the resource collection is being built (the “compile phase”). Set to false to install a gem while the chef-client is configuring the node (the “converge phase”). Possible values: nil (for verbose warnings), true (to warn once per chef-client run), or false (to remove all warnings). Recommended value: false.
trans-unit.target: 控制在节点上安装gem的阶段。设置为 true 以在构建资源集合时安装gem（“编译阶段”）。设置为 false 可在Chef客户端配置节点时安装gem（“融合阶段”）。可能的值： nil （用于详细警告）， true （在每次厨师客户运行时警告一次）或 false （用于删除所有警告）。推荐值： false 。

trans-unit.source: Cookbook and custom resource names should contain only alphanumeric characters. A hyphen (-) is a valid character and may be used in cookbook and custom resource names, but it is discouraged. Chef Infra Client will return an error if a hyphen is not converted to an underscore (_) when referencing from a recipe the name of a custom resource in which a hyphen is located.
trans-unit.target: 食谱和自定义资源名称应仅包含字母数字字符。连字符（ - ）是有效字符，可以在菜谱和自定义资源名称中使用，但不建议使用。如果从配方中引用连字符所在的自定义资源名称，则如果连字符未转换为下划线（ _ ），则Chef Infra Client将返回错误。

trans-unit.target: 食谱和自定义资源名称应仅包含字母数字字符。连字符（ - ）是有效字符，可以在菜谱和自定义资源名称中使用，但不建议使用。如果从配方中引用连字符所在的自定义资源的名称，则如果连字符未转换为下划线（ _ ），则厨师客户将返回错误。

trans-unit.source: Cookbook development differs from traditional Ruby software development, so we maintain a tailored set of built-in cops from Rubocop. Cops that are not useful for cookbook development are disabled and occasionally we change the configuration of a rule to enforce a different behavior. We’ve also extended the base RuboCop package with a set of our own Chef Infra-specific cops. These cops are only found in Cookstyle and will help you to write more reliable and future-proof cookbooks.
trans-unit.target: Cookbook的开发不同于传统的Ruby软件开发，因此我们维护着Rubocop量身定制的内置警察。对于食谱开发无用的警察会被禁用，有时我们会更改规则的配置以强制执行其他行为。我们还扩展了基本的RuboCop软件包，其中包含一组我们自己的Chef Infra专用警察。这些警察只能在Cookstyle中找到，它们将帮助您编写更可靠和面向未来的食谱。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle Linting
trans-unit.target: 烹调式绒毛

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle increases code quality by:
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle通过以下方式提高代码质量。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle is a code linting tool that helps you write better Chef Infra cookbooks by detecting and automatically correcting style, syntax, and logic mistakes in your code.
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle是一款代码精简工具,通过检测并自动纠正代码中的样式、语法和逻辑错误,帮助你写出更好的Chef Infra烹饪书。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle is more stable than Rubocop and is customized for Chef Cookbook code. This means that linting Cookbooks with Cookstyle will be more consistent and less likely to produce CI test failures.
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle比Rubocop更稳定,是为Chef Cookbook代码定制的。这意味着用Cookstyle对Cookbook进行加绒会更一致,更不容易产生CI测试失败。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle is powered by the RuboCop linting engine. RuboCop ships with over three-hundred rules, or cops, designed to detect common Ruby coding mistakes and enforce a common coding style. We’ve customized Cookstyle with a subset of those cops that we believe are perfectly tailored for cookbook development. We also ship Chef-specific cops that catch common cookbook coding mistakes, cleanup portions of code that are no longer necessary, and detect deprecations that prevent cookbooks from running on the latest releases of Chef Infra Client.
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle由RuboCop棉绒引擎提供动力。RuboCop附带了三百多个规则或警察，旨在检测常见的Ruby编码错误并实施通用的编码样式。我们已经定制了Cookstyle，其中包含一些我们认为非常适合食谱开发的警察。我们还提供了特定于Chef的警察，这些警察可以捕获常见的菜谱编码错误，清理不再需要的代码部分，并检测过时的使用情况，从而阻止菜谱在Chef Infra Client的最新版本上运行。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle is run from the command line, typically against a single cookbook and all of the Ruby files contained within it:
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle是从命令行运行的,通常是针对一个cookbook和其中包含的所有Ruby文件。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle may also be run from the root of an individual cookbook directory:
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle也可以从单个cookbook目录的根部运行。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle output:
trans-unit.target: 饪式输出。

trans-unit.source: Cookstyle returns a list, via standard output, that shows the results of the evaluation:
trans-unit.target: Cookstyle通过标准输出返回一个列表,显示评估的结果。

trans-unit.target: Cookstyle对Rubocop

trans-unit.source: Create a file named chef-server.rb that is located in the /etc/opscode/ directory. See the chef-server.rb section below for an example of the settings and values that are required. The ha['ebs_device'] setting must specify the actual /dev device name that is reported by the machine’s kernel, which may not be the same value that is reported by Amazon Web Services (AWS). For example, Amazon Web Services (AWS) may refer to a volume as /dev/sdf through the management console, but to the Linux kernel on the instance, it may appear as /dev/xvdf.
trans-unit.target: 在 /etc/opscode/ 目录中创建一个名为Chef-server.rb的文件。请参阅下面的chef-server.rb部分，以获取所需设置和值的示例。该 ha['ebs_device'] 设置必须指定实际 /dev 由机器的内核，这可能不是由亚马逊网络服务（AWS）报告相同的值报告的设备名称。例如，Amazon Web Services（AWS）可能通过管理控制台将卷称为 /dev/sdf ，但对于实例上的Linux内核，它可能显示为 /dev/xvdf 。

trans-unit.source: Create and then upload a Chef Habitat package for a Chef InSpec profile. Like the inspec habitat profile create command, Chef InSpec will validate the profile, fetch and vendor any dependencies (if necessary), and build the Chef Habitat package with a dependency on the latest InSpec. However, instead of saving the package locally to the workstation, Chef InSpec will upload it to the depot defined in the HAB_DEPOT environment variable. If HAB_DEPOT is not defined, the package will be uploaded to the public Chef Habitat depot at https://app.habitat.sh.
trans-unit.target: 创建并上传Chef InSpec配置文件的Chef Habitat程序包。像 inspec habitat profile create 命令一样，Chef InSpec将验证概况，获取和提供任何依赖关系（如有必要），并使用对最新InSpec的依赖关系来构建Chef Habitat软件包。但是，Chef InSpec不会将软件包保存到本地，而是将其上传到 HAB_DEPOT 环境变量中定义的软件仓库。如果 HAB_DEPOT ，则该软件包将通过https://app.habitat.sh上载到公共Chef Habitat仓库。

trans-unit.source: Creating and editing the contents of a data bag or a data bag item from a recipe is not recommended. The recommended method of updating a data bag or a data bag item is to use knife and the knife data bag subcommand. If this action must be done from a recipe, please note the following:
trans-unit.target: 不建议从配方中创建和编辑数据袋或数据袋物品的内容。推荐的更新数据袋或数据袋项目的方法是使用刀和 knife data bag 命令。如果必须从配方中执行此操作，请注意以下几点：

trans-unit.source: Creating artifacts for a specific origin requires that you have access to the that origin’s private key. The private origin key will be used to sign the artifact when it is built by the hab plan build command. Origin keys are kept in $HOME/.hab/cache/keys on the host machine when running hab as a non-root user and /hab/cache/keys when running as root (including in the studio). For more information on origin keys, see Keys.
trans-unit.target: 为特定来源创建工件需要您有权访问该来源的私钥。当由 hab plan build 命令构建工件时，私有原始密钥将用于对工件进行签名。以非 $HOME/.hab/cache/keys 用户身份运行 hab 时，原始密钥保存在主机上的$ HOME / .hab / cache / keys中，以root身份运行时（包括在Studio中），原始密钥保存在 /hab/cache/keys 中。有关原始密钥的更多信息，请参见密钥。

trans-unit.source: Credential sets are intended to work hand-in-hand with the underlying credentials storage facility of the transport. For example, if you have a ~/.ssh/config file specifying that the sally-key.pem file should be used with the host somehost.com, and you have a credential set that specifies that host, then when Train tries to connect to that host, the SSH library will automatically use the SSH config file to use the indicated key.
trans-unit.target: 凭据集旨在与传输的基础凭据存储功能配合使用。例如，如果您有一个 ~/.ssh/config 文件，该文件指定sally-key.pem文件应与主机 somehost.com 一起使用，并且您有一个凭据集指定该主机，则当Train尝试连接时到该主机，SSH库将自动使用SSH配置文件来使用指示的密钥。

trans-unit.source: Credentials for use with Target Mode (e.g. chef-client --target switch.example.org) can also be stored as a separate profile in the credentials file. The name of the profile should match the DNS name of the target, and must be surrounded by single quotes when the name contains a period. For example: ['switch.example.org']. Keys that are valid configuration options will be passed to train, such as port.
trans-unit.target: 与目标模式一起使用的凭证（例如 chef-client --target switch.example.org ）也可以作为单独的配置文件存储在凭证文件中。配置文件的名称应与目标的DNS名称匹配，并且名称中包含句点时，必须用单引号引起来。例如： ['switch.example.org'] 。有效配置选项的密钥将传递给训练，例如 port 。

trans-unit.source: DNF automatically synchronizes remote metadata to a local cache. Chef Infra Client creates a copy of the local cache, and then stores it in-memory during a Chef Infra Client run. The in-memory cache allows packages to be installed during a Chef Infra Client run without the need to continue synchronizing the remote metadata to the local cache while a Chef Infra Client run is in-progress.
trans-unit.target: DNF自动将远程元数据同步到本地缓存。Chef Infra Client会创建本地缓存的副本,然后在Chef Infra Client运行期间将其存储在内存中。内存缓存允许在Chef Infra Client运行期间安装包,而不需要在Chef Infra Client运行过程中继续将远程元数据同步到本地缓存。

trans-unit.source: DRBD This port range must be open between all back end servers in a high availability configuration that uses DRBD.

trans-unit.source: DRBD can be configured to utilize more bandwidth during the initial synchronization. For Red Hat and CentOS 6:

trans-unit.source: DRBD configuration allows for custom handlers when a split-brain event happens. The basic handler sends a notification email to a configurable email address so the issue can be investigated.
trans-unit.target: 当发生 split-brain 事件时，DRBD配置允许自定义处理程序。基本处理程序将通知电子邮件发送到可配置的电子邮件地址，以便可以调查此问题。

trans-unit.source: DRBD configurations are no longer supported. See End of Life Products.
trans-unit.target: 不再支持DRBD配置。请参阅报废产品。

trans-unit.source: DRBD is a shared-nothing system. Data is replicated between hosts over a dedicated network link rather than stored on a central network-attached storage (NAS) or storage attached network (SAN) to which all hosts are connected. The most critical issue for storage in a high availability topology is loss of or corruption of data. Maximizing the amount of data that can be passed over the wire while all systems are up and running correctly minimizes the chance that something will be lost or unrecoverable if a host goes down.
trans-unit.target: DRBD是一个共享无的系统。数据通过专用网络链路在主机之间复制,而不是存储在所有主机都连接的中央网络附加存储(NAS)或存储附加网络(SAN)上。高可用性拓扑中存储最关键的问题是数据丢失或损坏。在所有系统都正常运行的情况下,最大限度地增加可以通过线路传递的数据量,可以最大限度地减少主机宕机时丢失或无法恢复的可能性。

trans-unit.source: DRBD is a supported high availability configuration option for the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: DRBD 是 Chef 服务器支持的高可用性配置选项。

trans-unit.source: DRBD may be resized. First, make a backup of the Chef server data.
trans-unit.target: DRBD可以调整大小。首先,对Chef服务器的数据进行备份。

trans-unit.source: DRBD on the first back-end server will sync to the second back-end server and will become the clean secondary FQDN.

trans-unit.source: Data Lifecycle manages the retention of events, service groups, Chef Infra Client runs, compliance reports and scans in Chef Automate. Chef Automate stores data from the ingest-service,event-feed-service, compliance-service and applications-service in Elasticsearch or PostgreSQL. Over time, you may wish to remove that data from Chef Automate by using the data lifecycle settings.

trans-unit.source: Data bags store global variables as JSON data. Data bags are indexed for searching and can be loaded by a cookbook or accessed during a search.

trans-unit.source: Data can be passed to a definition from more than one recipe. Use a definition to create a compile-time macro that can be referenced by resources during the converge phase. For example, when both /etc/aliases and /etc/sudoers require updates from multiple recipes during a single chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: 数据可以从多个配方传递到定义。使用定义创建一个编译时宏，在聚合阶段资源可以引用该编译时宏。例如，当 /etc/aliases 和 /etc/sudoers 都需要在一次厨师客户端运行期间从多个配方进行更新时。

trans-unit.source: Debian platform only. The relative priority of the program for start and shutdown ordering. May be an integer or a Hash. An integer is used to define the start run levels; stop run levels are then 100-integer. A Hash is used to define values for specific run levels. For example, { 2 => [:start, 20], 3 => [:stop, 55] } will set a priority of twenty for run level two and a priority of fifty-five for run level three.
trans-unit.target: 仅限于Debian平台。用于启动和关闭顺序的程序的相对优先级。可以是整数或哈希。整数用于定义开始运行级别；然后将停止运行级别设置为100整数。哈希用于定义特定运行级别的值。例如， { 2 => [:start, 20], 3 => [:stop, 55] } 将为运行级别2设置优先级为20，为运行级别3设置优先级为55。
